Title.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the management of a pulmonary valve mass suspicious of being a myxoma in a patient with multiple comorbidities.

Participants.evidence: The patient, a 77-year-old male with chronic kidney disease, type 1 diabetes mellitus, and hypertension, presented with a pulmonary valve mass.

Intervention.evidence: The patient underwent high-risk staged percutaneous coronary intervention followed by dual antiplatelet therapy.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the management of a pulmonary valve mass suspicious of being a myxoma in a patient with multiple comorbidities.

Method_Outcome.evidence: At six months follow-up, the patient showed no complications such as stroke or pulmonary embolism, and the echocardiogram indicated stable mass size and improved ejection fraction.

Result_Outcome.evidence: At six months follow-up, the patient showed no complications such as stroke or pulmonary embolism, and the echocardiogram indicated stable mass size and improved ejection fraction.

Harms.evidence: At six months follow-up, the patient showed no complications such as stroke or pulmonary embolism.
